compounddef.title: RAWWRITE Write N-dimensional Array From File

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para:
The syntax for rawwrite is function rawwrite(fname,x,byteorder) where fname is the name of the file to write to, and the (numeric) array x is writen to the file in its native type (e.g. if x is of type int16, then it will be written to the file as 16-bit signed integers. If byteorder is left unspecified, the file is assumed to be of the same byte-order as the machine FreeMat is running on. If you wish to force a particular byte order, specify the byteorder argument as
'le','ieee-le','little-endian','littleEndian','little'
'be','ieee-be','big-endian','bigEndian','big'
